alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued May 01 at 4:39AM EDT until May 01 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Escambia Coastal, Santa Rosa Coastal and Okaloosa Coastal Counties. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While the rip current risk and surf heights are expected to decrease for the Alabama coast this morning, guidance indicates that surf heights between 3-4 feet as well as a high risk of rip currents will persist today for the western Florida Panhandle coast. This has necessitated extending the High Risk of Rip Currents through this afternoon for the western Florida Panhandle coast. Expecting surf and the rip risk to then quickly decrease early this evening.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal
